1.text: Wherefore thou art without excuse, O man, whosoever thou art that judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself; for thou that judgest dost practise the same things.

2.text: And we know that the judgment of God is according to truth against them that practise such things.

3.text: And reckonest thou this, O man, who judgest them that practise such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?

4.text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering, not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

5.text: but after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up for thyself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;

6.text: who will render to every man according to his works:

7.text: to them that by patience in well-doing seek for glory and honor and incorruption, eternal life:

8.text: but unto them that are factious, and obey not the truth, but obey unrighteousness, shall be wrath and indignation,

9.text: tribulation and anguish, upon every soul of man that worketh evil, of the Jew first, and also of the Greek;

10.text: but glory and honor and peace to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek:

11.text: for there is no respect of persons with God.

12.text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without the law: and as many as have sinned under the law shall be judged by the law;

13.text: for not the hearers of the law are just before God, but the doers of the law shall be justified:

14.text: (for when Gentiles that have not the law do by nature the things of the law, these, not having the law, are the law unto themselves;

15.text: in that they show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience bearing witness therewith, and their thoughts one with another accusing or else excusing them);

16.text: in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men, according to my gospel, by Jesus Christ.

17.text: But if thou bearest the name of a Jew, and restest upon the law, and gloriest in God,

18.text: and knowest his will, and approvest the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law,

19.text: and art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind, a light of them that are in darkness,

20.text: a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babes, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth;

21.text: thou therefore that teachest another, teachest thou not thyself? thou that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?

22.text: thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou rob temples?

23.text: thou who gloriest in the law, through thy transgression of the law dishonorest thou God?

24.text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you, even as it is written.

25.text: For circumcision indeed profiteth, if thou be a doer of the law: but if thou be a transgressor of the law, thy circumcision is become uncircumcision.

26.text: If therefore the uncircumcision keep the ordinances of the law, shall not his uncircumcision be reckoned for circumcision?

27.text: and shall not the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfil the law, judge thee, who with the letter and circumcision art a transgressor of the law?

28.text: For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly; neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh:

29.text: but he is a Jew who is one inwardly; and circumcision is that of the heart, in the spirit not in the letter; whose praise is not of men, but of God.
